study_plan.title: Korean Language Study Plan for TOPIK 6
study_plan.overview: This study plan is designed for a beginner aiming to achieve TOPIK 6 proficiency in one year by dedicating 10 hours per week to study.

activity.item: Learn 20 new vocabulary words using flashcards.
Practice vocabulary using Duolingo for 30 minutes.
Listen to a Korean podcast and summarize key points.
Watch a Korean drama episode with subtitles.
Study basic sentence structures and practice through exercises.
Complete grammar exercises in a textbook.
Engage in conversation with a language partner for 30 minutes.
Practice pronunciation and intonation using online resources.
Read a short Korean article and outline its main ideas.
Use a reading app to enhance skills for 30 minutes.
Take a practice test focusing on reading comprehension.
Review and analyze the results of the practice test.

listening.item: Utilize Korean music and podcasts to develop listening skills.
Watch Korean films and dramas without subtitles for practice.

reading.item: Read Korean news websites to encounter formal and conversational language.
Use graded readers to build reading comprehension gradually.

writing.item: Maintain a daily journal in Korean to improve writing fluency.
Participate in language exchange forums to practice writing.

speaking.item: Practice speaking with a native speaker or language partner.
Record yourself speaking to track improvements in pronunciation.

vocabulary.item: Use spaced repetition software (SRS) for effective vocabulary retention.
Group vocabulary by themes for organized learning.

grammar.item: Study grammar rules through textbooks and online courses.

plan.item: Focus on basic vocabulary and grammar.
Establish a study routine and practice listening daily.
Begin practicing speaking and writing regularly.
Start reading simple texts and articles in Korean.
Engage with more complex materials (books, films).
Practice full-length TOPIK tests to assess progress.
Intensive study of past TOPIK exam papers.
Focus on skill gaps identified in mock exams.

tips.item: Stay consistent with study sessions for long-term improvement.
Find a language partner to enhance practical skills.
Immerse yourself in the language daily through media and conversation.
